name: scroungy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
looking old, dirty, untidy, or in bad condition because of being used for a long time or not being cared for: Most people feel scroungy if they don't brush their teeth every day. We stayed in a scroungy hotel room.
More examplesFewer examplesA scroungy white dog stood in the garden, barking loudly.I can't believe she showed up for the interview wearing those scroungy jeans.Some of the people on the subway looked kind of scroungy.He has grown a scroungy-looking beard since I last saw him.
